column1: Narrator : The boat docks immediately in front of a wood. No sand beach, just trees right away.

column4: Narrator : It’s way too dark to make one more step. After all, it is the night.
PlayerSpeak : We can see much better

column1: Narrator : A particulary huge tree lays in the middle on the wood.

column5: Narrator : The tree is way too slippery to climb normally. CAPITAINE is going to have to use his skills.

column1: Choice : Let’s look at the rest of this little forest

column7: Narrator : While climbing, CAPITAINE slips and falls hard on his back.

column6: PlayerSpeak : At last, here I am

column4: PlayerSpeak : I don’t have a spy glass

column3: PlayerSpeak : I can see much clearer

column1: Narrator : The sun shines through the branches in this little pine wood. Only a little path opens in front of CAPITAINE. The vegetation is too dense too go anywhere else.
column2: Narrator : The night is clear and soft in the middle of this pine wood. Only a little path opens in front of CAPITAINE. The vegetation is too dense too go anywhere else.
column4: Narrator : A magnificient clearing appears before CAPITAINE. A trail runs along a loud stream of water. Another, on your left, is upholstered with dead leaves.
column5: Narrator : The moonshine covers a beautiful and calm clearing. A trail runs along a loud stream of water. Another, on your left, is upholstered with dead leaves.
column8: Narrator : Greatly tall oaks climb towards the blue sky, you cannot see their tops above your heads. CAPITAINE is on the crossroads of four path
column9: Narrator : Hard to see in the dark of the night, but CAPITAINE seems to be in a very tall forest, and at the crossroads of four paths
column13: Narrator : Le wood is tinier than is seemed. CAPITAINE sees the beach on the other side. The grass is freshly lit by the sun.
column14: Narrator : The moon perfectly covers the entirety of the small wood. The night is soft, but there’s nothing to do here.

column1: Narrator : CAPITAINE bumps into the beach, the wood stops here.
column2: Narrator : On the dirt trail, a luscious smell of smoke roams the air. A wooden pannel reads « Come drink ale and eat meat »
column3: Narrator : Vulgar laughs and clinks of metal echo through the wood. CAPITAINE doesn’t like this
column4: Narrator : The air smells of saw dust and iron. CAPITAINE obviously approaches a boat warehouse
column5: Narrator : CAPITAINE bumps into a enormous sand beach. Behind the dunes, a small nassel is wrecked on rocks.
column6: Narrator : A little path leads CAPITAINE to a cove. Someone lives here.
column7: Narrator : A little path leads CAPITAINE to a cove. Someone lives here.
column8: Narrator : A little path leads CAPITAINE to a cove. Someone lives here.
